Agency.Name: Langley Child Development Centre
Agency.AgencyDescription: Provides inclusive, family-centred early intervention services for children with special needs, from birth to 19 years of age. The <b>Infant Development Program</b> offers home visits to families with young children from birth to age three who have delays or are at risk for delays. The <b>Supported Child Development Program</b> supports children and youth in their neighbourhood child care settings. The <b>Aboriginal Infant and Supported Child Development Program</b> utilizes cultural teachings to engage children of Aboriginal heritage who have or are at risk for delays. The <b>Child and Youth Program</b> provides recreational activities, after-school life skills, and summer day camps for school-aged children. A resource library and educational opportunities are available for parents, caregivers, and professionals. All programs provide social and networking opportunities for parents.

Site.Name: Langley Child Development Centre
Site.SiteDescription: Provides inclusive, family-centred early intervention services for children with special needs, from birth to 19 years of age. The <b>Infant Development Program</b> offers home visits to families with young children from birth to age three who have delays or are at risk for delays. The <b>Supported Child Development Program</b> supports children and youth in their neighbourhood child care settings. The <b>Aboriginal Infant and Supported Child Development Program</b> utilizes cultural teachings to engage children of Aboriginal heritage who have or are at risk for delays. The <b>Child and Youth Program</b> provides recreational activities, after-school life skills, and summer day camps for school-aged children. A resource library and educational opportunities are available for parents, caregivers, and professionals. All programs provide social and networking opportunities for parents.

SiteService.Name: Langley Child Development Centre
SiteService.Description: Provides inclusive, family-centred early intervention services for children with special needs, from birth to 19 years of age. The <b>Infant Development Program</b> offers home visits to families with young children from birth to age three who have delays or are at risk for delays. The <b>Supported Child Development Program</b> supports children and youth in their neighbourhood child care settings. The <b>Aboriginal Infant and Supported Child Development Program</b> utilizes cultural teachings to engage children of Aboriginal heritage who have or are at risk for delays. The <b>Child and Youth Program</b> provides recreational activities, after-school life skills, and summer day camps for school-aged children. A resource library and educational opportunities are available for parents, caregivers, and professionals. All programs provide social and networking opportunities for parents.

Agency.Name: Stepping Stone Community Services Society
Agency.AgencyDescription: Provides psychosocial rehabilitation programs for adults living in Langley who are recovering from a mental illness. Offers a clubhouse, supported work and volunteer opportunities, and community living support. Programs assist individuals to build confidence, develop skills, and improve quality of life in areas of personal life, leisure, and pre-employment. Referrals through the Langley Mental Health Centre (604-514-7940). Also provides housing in partnership with West Fraser Housing Society; see independent listing for details. Office hours are 9 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday; program hours vary.

Site.Name: Employment Services
Site.SiteDescription: Provides job search assistance to individuals who have experienced barriers to employment due to mental illness. Services include assistance with identifying employment goals, resume writing help, and job search assistance. Provides ongoing support for both clients and employers. Referrals through the Langley Mental Health Centre.

SiteService.Name: Employment Services
SiteService.Description: Provides job search assistance to individuals who have experienced barriers to employment due to mental illness. Services include assistance with identifying employment goals, resume writing help, and job search assistance. Provides ongoing support for both clients and employers. Referrals through the Langley Mental Health Centre.

Site.Name: Starting Point Outreach Services
Site.SiteDescription: Provides services to people who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless. Services include housing search assistance, help with applying for government funding, support with housing applications, housing loss prevention, tenancy support and information, financial literacy training, support with housing applications, and short-term rent subsidies. Also offers follow-up housing support. The <strong>Homeless Outreach Program</strong> provides outreach to adults who are homeless, at risk of becoming homeless, or difficult to house; funded by BC Housing. The <strong>Youth Homelessness Initiative</strong> program serves youth up to and including age 25 who are homeless or at risk of homelessness; funded by Vancouver Foundation. Offers a free postal box where homeless individuals can receive mail during drop-in hours. Programs are offered in partnership with Aldergrove Neighbourhood Services Society. Serves Langley. Drop-in hours are 9 am to 1 pm Monday to Friday, with appointments from 1 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

SiteService.Name: Starting Point Outreach Services
SiteService.Description: Provides services to people who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless. Services include housing search assistance, help with applying for government funding, support with housing applications, housing loss prevention, tenancy support and information, financial literacy training, support with housing applications, and short-term rent subsidies. Also offers follow-up housing support. The <strong>Homeless Outreach Program</strong> provides outreach to adults who are homeless, at risk of becoming homeless, or difficult to house; funded by BC Housing. The <strong>Youth Homelessness Initiative</strong> program serves youth up to and including age 25 who are homeless or at risk of homelessness; funded by Vancouver Foundation. Offers a free postal box where homeless individuals can receive mail during drop-in hours. Programs are offered in partnership with Aldergrove Neighbourhood Services Society. Serves Langley. Drop-in hours are 9 am to 1 pm Monday to Friday, with appointments from 1 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Starting Point Outreach Services - Take Home Naloxone
Site.SiteDescription: Provides harm reduction supplies, along with harm reduction education and referrals to health services, addictions services, and other social supports. Provides opioid users with free <strong>Take Home Naloxone Kits</strong> (Narcan) that can be used to reverse the effects of overdoses from opioids like fentanyl, heroin, methadone, morphine, and oxycodone.

SiteService.Name: Starting Point Outreach Services - Take Home Naloxone
SiteService.Description: Provides harm reduction supplies, along with harm reduction education and referrals to health services, addictions services, and other social supports. Provides opioid users with free <strong>Take Home Naloxone Kits</strong> (Narcan) that can be used to reverse the effects of overdoses from opioids like fentanyl, heroin, methadone, morphine, and oxycodone.

Agency.Name: Langley Youth and Family Services
Agency.AgencyDescription: Provides counselling and intervention for children and youth up to age 17 to prevent anti-social behaviour and conflict with the law. Family involvement is required. Referrals from schools, social service agencies, other community members, and the RCMP for children and youth up to 17 years of age. No fee for service. Program jointly operated by Langley City and Langley Township; serves residents of both communities. Hours are from 8:30 am to 12 noon and 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Langley Youth and Family Services
Site.SiteDescription: Provides counselling and intervention for children and youth up to age 17 to prevent anti-social behaviour and conflict with the law. Family involvement is required. Referrals from schools, social service agencies, other community members, and the RCMP for children and youth up to 17 years of age. No fee for service. Program jointly operated by Langley City and Langley Township; serves residents of both communities. Hours are from 8:30 am to 12 noon and 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

Program jointly operated by Langley City and Langley Township; serves residents of both communities. Hours are from 8:30 am to 12 noon and 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

Agency.Name: Mrs O's Swim Group
Agency.AgencyDescription: Promotes increased self-acceptance of, and networking among, large women size 18 or over. Offers swimming and other social/recreational opportunities. Swims are 7:30 am to 8:30 am Saturdays. Nonprofit society.

Site.Name: Mrs O's Swim Group
Site.SiteDescription: Promotes increased self-acceptance of, and networking among, large women size 18 or over. Offers swimming and other social/recreational opportunities. Swims are 7:30 am to 8:30 am Saturdays. Nonprofit society.

SiteService.Name: Mrs O's Swim Group
SiteService.Description: Promotes increased self-acceptance of, and networking among, large women size 18 or over. Offers swimming and other social/recreational opportunities. Swims are 7:30 am to 8:30 am Saturdays. Nonprofit society.

Agency.Name: Last Post Fund
Agency.AgencyDescription: Delivers the <b>Veterans Affairs Canada Funeral and Burial Program</b> for veterans across Canada. May provide financial assistance toward expenses for funeral, cremation, burial, and grave marking. Eligibility is based on military service criteria as well as financial criteria outlined in the Veterans Burial Regulations 2005 (see website). Offices are open Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Last Post Fund
Site.SiteDescription: Delivers the <b>Veterans Affairs Canada Funeral and Burial Program</b> for veterans across Canada. May provide financial assistance toward expenses for funeral, cremation, burial, and grave marking. Eligibility is based on military service criteria as well as financial criteria outlined in the Veterans Burial Regulations 2005 (see website). Offices are open Monday to Friday.

SiteService.Name: Last Post Fund

May provide financial assistance toward expenses for funeral, cremation, burial, and grave marking. Eligibility is based on military service criteria as well as financial criteria outlined in the Veterans Burial Regulations 2005 (see website). Offices are open Monday to Friday.

Agency.Name: Le Centre Culturel Francophone de Vancouver
Agency.AgencyDescription: Promotes French culture through cultural and community-oriented activities such as concerts, dances, festivals, dinners, conferences, and a summer day camp for children ages six to 12. Also offers French language educational resources such as a library and video library, and French classes for adults. Office hours 9 am to 9 pm Monday to Thursday, 9:30 am to 5:30 pm Fridays, and 10 am to 4 pm Saturdays.

Site.Name: Le Centre Culturel Francophone de Vancouver
Site.SiteDescription: Promotes French culture through cultural and community-oriented activities such as concerts, dances, festivals, dinners, conferences, and a summer day camp for children ages six to 12. Also offers French language educational resources such as a library and video library, and French classes for adults. Office hours 9 am to 9 pm Monday to Thursday, 9:30 am to 5:30 pm Fridays, and 10 am to 4 pm Saturdays.

SiteService.Name: Le Centre Culturel Francophone de Vancouver
SiteService.Description: Promotes French culture through cultural and community-oriented activities such as concerts, dances, festivals, dinners, conferences, and a summer day camp for children ages six to 12. Also offers French language educational resources such as a library and video library, and French classes for adults. Office hours 9 am to 9 pm Monday to Thursday, 9:30 am to 5:30 pm Fridays, and 10 am to 4 pm Saturdays.

Agency.Name: Learning Disabilities Association of BC - Vancouver Chapter (LDAV)
Agency.AgencyDescription: Provides programs to promote the education, social development, legal rights, and well-being of people with learning disabilities. Provides advocacy and monthly information and support meetings for parents of children and youth with learning disabilities, and for professionals. Also offers specialized tutoring for children and youth. Membership is open to anyone interested in fostering the potential of people with learning disabilities. Serves Burnaby, Richmond, and Vancouver. Office hours are 10 am to 4 pm Monday to Friday, and by appointment on Saturdays. Nonprofit society.

Site.Name: Learning Disabilities Association of BC - Vancouver Chapter (LDAV)
Site.SiteDescription: Provides programs to promote the education, social development, legal rights, and well-being of people with learning disabilities. Provides advocacy and monthly information and support meetings for parents of children and youth with learning disabilities, and for professionals. Also offers specialized tutoring for children and youth. Membership is open to anyone interested in fostering the potential of people with learning disabilities. Serves Burnaby, Richmond, and Vancouver. Office hours are 10 am to 4 pm Monday to Friday, and by appointment on Saturdays. Nonprofit society.

SiteService.Name: Learning Disabilities Association of BC - Vancouver Chapter (LDAV)
SiteService.Description: Provides programs to promote the education, social development, legal rights, and well-being of people with learning disabilities. Also offers specialized tutoring for children and youth. Membership is open to anyone interested in fostering the potential of people with learning disabilities. Serves Burnaby, Richmond, and Vancouver. Office hours are 10 am to 4 pm Monday to Friday, and by appointment on Saturdays. Nonprofit society.

Agency.Name: Adoptive Families Association of BC (AFABC)
Agency.AgencyDescription: Provides information about adoption through BC's waiting child program. Educates and supports prospective and adoptive families in BC. Services include adoption promotion activities, a parent support network, and support groups for waiting and adoptive parents. Offers adoption education programs, a resource centre, and publishes a quarterly magazine. Also provides meeting space for support groups. Members can speak with youth workers (via website or phone), share stories and creative projects, contribute ideas to inspire positive changes for youth in care, and learn new skills. Youth can attend monthly&nbsp;get-togethers; free food and bus tickets are available.&nbsp;<strong>Speak-Out Youth </strong>is an online resource (www.speakoutyouthzone.com) for youth ages 13 to 24 who are or were living in foster care or in an adoptive family.&nbsp;<strong>Aged-Out</strong> is an online resource (www.agedout.com) for young adults&nbsp;who were in&nbsp;government care in BC; it provides information and resources about services available to young adults, and acts as a learning tool to help people feel empowered as they leave care. Office hours are 9:30 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday. Nonprofit society.

Site.Name: Adoptive Families Association of BC (AFABC)
Site.SiteDescription: Provides information about adoption through BC's waiting child program. Educates and supports prospective and adoptive families in BC. Services include adoption promotion activities, a parent support network, and support groups for waiting and adoptive parents. Offers adoption education programs, a resource centre, and publishes a quarterly magazine. Also provides meeting space for support groups. Members can speak with youth workers (via website or phone), share stories and creative projects, contribute ideas to inspire positive changes for youth in care, and learn new skills. Youth can attend monthly&nbsp;get-togethers; free food and bus tickets are available.&nbsp;<strong>Speak-Out Youth </strong>is an online resource (www.speakoutyouthzone.com) for youth ages 13 to 24 who are or were living in foster care or in an adoptive family.&nbsp;<strong>Aged-Out</strong> is an online resource (www.agedout.com) for young adults&nbsp;who were in&nbsp;government care in BC; it provides information and resources about services available to young adults, and acts as a learning tool to help people feel empowered as they leave care. Office hours are 9:30 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday. Nonprofit society.

Office hours are 9:30 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday. Nonprofit society.

Agency.Name: Act II Child and Family Services
Agency.AgencyDescription: Provides specialized assistance to individuals, children, and families who have experienced crisis, violence, and/or abuse. Hours are 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Monday to Friday with some evening appointments available. Nonprofit society.

Site.Name: Maple Ridge Fee-for-Service Counselling Program
Site.SiteDescription: Offers counselling for a variety of issues. Self-referral. Fees are charged; sliding scale, $45 to $100 per session, based on family income.

SiteService.Name: Maple Ridge Fee-for-Service Counselling Program
SiteService.Description: Offers counselling for a variety of issues. Self-referral. Fees are charged; sliding scale, $45 to $100 per session, based on family income.

Site.Name: Sexual Health in Family Treatment (SHIFT) Program
Site.SiteDescription: Provides family-based assessment and treatment to children under 12 years of age who have sexual behaviour problems such as preoccupation, coercion, aggression, or secrecy. Serves the Tri-cities and Ridge Meadows.

SiteService.Name: Sexual Health in Family Treatment (SHIFT) Program
SiteService.Description: Provides family-based assessment and treatment to children under 12 years of age who have sexual behaviour problems such as preoccupation, coercion, aggression, or secrecy. Serves the Tri-cities and Ridge Meadows.

Site.Name: Family Program
Site.SiteDescription: Assists families who are experiencing serious parenting difficulties. Provides individual parenting sessions and supervised opportunities to practice newly acquired parenting skills. Referral through MCFD.

SiteService.Name: Family Program
SiteService.Description: Assists families who are experiencing serious parenting difficulties. Provides individual parenting sessions and supervised opportunities to practice newly acquired parenting skills. Referral through MCFD.

Site.Name: Safe Choice Program
Site.SiteDescription: Independent living suites for women (and their children) seeking safety from family violence. Staff provide support, information, advocacy, and counselling. Residents may stay up to one year. Referral is through a transition house. Serves the lower mainland. Funded by BC Housing.

SiteService.Name: Safe Choice Program
SiteService.Description: Independent living suites for women (and their children) seeking safety from family violence. Staff provide support, information, advocacy, and counselling. Residents may stay up to one year. Referral is through a transition house. Serves the lower mainland. Funded by BC Housing.

Site.Name: Tri-Cities Office
Site.SiteDescription: Provides specialized assistance to individuals, children, and families who have experienced crisis, violence, and/or abuse. Hours are 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Monday to Friday with some evening appointments available.

SiteService.Name: Tri-Cities Office
SiteService.Description: Provides specialized assistance to individuals, children, and families who have experienced crisis, violence, and/or abuse. Hours are 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Monday to Friday with some evening appointments available.

Site.Name: Maple Ridge Office
Site.SiteDescription: Provides specialized assistance to individuals, children, and families who have experienced crisis, violence, and/or abuse. Hours are 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Monday to Friday with some evening appointments available. Nonprofit society.

SiteService.Name: Maple Ridge Office
SiteService.Description: Provides specialized assistance to individuals, children, and families who have experienced crisis, violence, and/or abuse. Hours are 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Monday to Friday with some evening appointments available. Nonprofit society.

Site.Name: Clinical Counselling Program - Tri-Cities Office
Site.SiteDescription: Provides counselling to children and youth that have emotional and behavioural issues arising from traumatic events such as sexual abuse, violence, family breakup, death of a loved one and other grief and loss issues. Sexual abuse counselling may be self-referral; all other counselling requires a referral through MCFD. No cost. Office hours are 8:30 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday. Funded as a <b>Sexual Abuse Intervention Program (SAIP)</b>.

SiteService.Name: Clinical Counselling Program - Tri-Cities Office
SiteService.Description: Provides counselling to children and youth that have emotional and behavioural issues arising from traumatic events such as sexual abuse, violence, family breakup, death of a loved one and other grief and loss issues. Sexual abuse counselling may be self-referral; all other counselling requires a referral through MCFD. No cost. Office hours are 8:30 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday. Funded as a <b>Sexual Abuse Intervention Program (SAIP)</b>.

Site.Name: Sexual Abuse Intervention Program (SAIP) (Disabilities)
Site.SiteDescription: Offers counselling to children and youth with disabilities who have disclosed sexual abuse.

SiteService.Name: Sexual Abuse Intervention Program (SAIP) (Disabilities)
SiteService.Description: Offers counselling to children and youth with disabilities who have disclosed sexual abuse.

Site.Name: Surrey Office
Site.SiteDescription: Provides specialized assistance to individuals, children, and families who have experienced crisis, violence, and/or abuse. Hours are 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Monday to Friday with some evening appointments available.

Agency.Name: The Adler Centre
Agency.AgencyDescription: Educational organization provides speakers and workshop leaders for the education, medical, and business communities. Offers a family resource centre and a library. Provides the <b>STEP (Systematic Training for Effective Parenting)</b> program, STEP leadership courses, workshops, and an annual conference. Publishes a quarterly newsletter. Master's level practicum students provide counselling services to families, couples, and individuals of all ages on a variety of subjects through the <b>Adler Counselling Clinic</b>. Fees are $50 per session for individual counselling, and $70 for couples counselling. Office hours are 9:30 am to 8:30 pm Monday to Saturday. Nonprofit society.

Site.Name: The Adler Centre
Site.SiteDescription: Educational organization provides speakers and workshop leaders for the education, medical, and business communities. Offers a family resource centre and a library. Provides the <b>STEP (Systematic Training for Effective Parenting)</b> program, STEP leadership courses, workshops, and an annual conference. Publishes a quarterly newsletter. Master's level practicum students provide counselling services to families, couples, and individuals of all ages on a variety of subjects through the <b>Adler Counselling Clinic</b>. Fees are $50 per session for individual counselling, and $70 for couples counselling. Office hours are 9:30 am to 8:30 pm Monday to Saturday. Nonprofit society.

SiteService.Name: The Adler Centre
SiteService.Description: Educational organization provides speakers and workshop leaders for the education, medical, and business communities. Offers a family resource centre and a library. Provides the <b>STEP (Systematic Training for Effective Parenting)</b> program, STEP leadership courses, workshops, and an annual conference. Publishes a quarterly newsletter. Master's level practicum students provide counselling services to families, couples, and individuals of all ages on a variety of subjects through the <b>Adler Counselling Clinic</b>. Fees are $50 per session for individual counselling, and $70 for couples counselling. Office hours are 9:30 am to 8:30 pm Monday to Saturday. Nonprofit society.

Agency.Name: Burnaby School District
Agency.AgencyDescription: Administers public schools from Kindergarten to Grade 12, as well as community and continuing education. Offers a wide range of educational services, including learning assistance, alternative education programs, community schools, education evaluation, diagnostic assessment, counselling, and speech therapy. Office hours are 8:30 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday from September to June, and 8 am to 3:30 pm July and August.

Site.Name: Language Instruction for Newcomers to Canada (LINC)
Site.SiteDescription: Morning, afternoon, and evening English classes for adults are held in two Burnaby locations. Funded by Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC).

AKA.Name: old name English Language Services for Adults (ELSA)

SiteService.Name: Language Instruction for Newcomers to Canada (LINC)

AKA.Name: old name English Language Services for Adults (ELSA)

SiteService.Description: Morning, afternoon, and evening English classes for adults are held in two Burnaby locations. Funded by Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC).

Site.Name: Community and Continuing Education Services
Site.SiteDescription: Offers general interest, vocational courses, academic, upgrading (<b>Foundations</b>), and high school completion at various locations in Burnaby.

SiteService.Name: Community and Continuing Education Services
SiteService.Description: Offers general interest, vocational courses, academic, upgrading (<b>Foundations</b>), and high school completion at various locations in Burnaby.

Site.Name: Alcohol and Drug Prevention Program
Site.SiteDescription: Provides alcohol and drug prevention programs that focus on building resiliency; offered at all elementary and secondary schools in the Burnaby School District.

SiteService.Name: Alcohol and Drug Prevention Program
SiteService.Description: Provides alcohol and drug prevention programs that focus on building resiliency; offered at all elementary and secondary schools in the Burnaby School District.

Site.Name: The Burnaby Youth Hub
Site.SiteDescription: A community partnership program that addresses multiple youth needs, by providing educational services for students ages 13 to 19 who have become disengaged from school and have high levels of non-attendance. Students work on self-paced courses with teachers. Online course work is also available.

SiteService.Name: The Burnaby Youth Hub
SiteService.Description: A community partnership program that addresses multiple youth needs, by providing educational services for students ages 13 to 19 who have become disengaged from school and have high levels of non-attendance. Students work on self-paced courses with teachers. Online course work is also available.

Site.Name: Settlement Workers in Schools (SWIS) Program
Site.SiteDescription: Provides settlement services for immigrant and refugee students in Burnaby attending Kindergarten to Grade 12, and their families. Helps immigrant and refugee families adjust and integrate into community, home, and schools. Settlement workers serve newcomers in English, but have cultural and language expertise in Arabic, Cantonese, Dari, Farsi, French, Korean, Kurdish, Lingala, Mandarin, Russian, Spanish, Swahili, Urdu, and Vietnamese. Office and program hours are 8:30 am to 4 pm Monday to Friday. Funded by Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC).

SiteService.Name: Settlement Workers in Schools (SWIS) Program
SiteService.Description: Provides settlement services for immigrant and refugee students in Burnaby attending Kindergarten to Grade 12, and their families. Helps immigrant and refugee families adjust and integrate into community, home, and schools. Settlement workers serve newcomers in English, but have cultural and language expertise in Arabic, Cantonese, Dari, Farsi, French, Korean, Kurdish, Lingala, Mandarin, Russian, Spanish, Swahili, Urdu, and Vietnamese. Office and program hours are 8:30 am to 4 pm Monday to Friday. Funded by Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC).

Site.Name: Schou Continuing Education Centre
Site.SiteDescription: Provides secondary school completion for Grades 11 and 12. Subjects include English, mathematics, social sciences, computer studies, and a wide range of electives. <b>Foundations</b> offers pre-Grade 10 upgrading in English, mathematics, science, computer studies, and social studies. Phone to make an appointment with an intake advisor.

SiteService.Name: Schou Continuing Education Centre
SiteService.Description: Provides secondary school completion for Grades 11 and 12. Subjects include English, mathematics, social sciences, computer studies, and a wide range of electives. <b>Foundations</b> offers pre-Grade 10 upgrading in English, mathematics, science, computer studies, and social studies. Phone to make an appointment with an intake advisor.

Agency.Name: Advertising Standards Canada (ASC)
Agency.AgencyDescription: Independent nonprofit body committed to creating and maintaining community confidence in advertising. Complaints about advertisements can be sent in by mail or submitted online. Office hours are 9 am to 5 pm ET.

Site.Name: Advertising Standards Canada (ASC)
Site.SiteDescription: Independent nonprofit body committed to creating and maintaining community confidence in advertising. Complaints about advertisements can be sent in by mail or submitted online. Office hours are 9 am to 5 pm ET.

SiteService.Name: Advertising Standards Canada (ASC)
SiteService.Description: Independent nonprofit body committed to creating and maintaining community confidence in advertising. Complaints about advertisements can be sent in by mail or submitted online. Office hours are 9 am to 5 pm ET.

Agency.Name: Affiliation of Multicultural Societies and Service Agencies of BC (AMSSA)
Agency.AgencyDescription: Province-wide association of agencies that provide multicultural programs serving newcomers and promoting culturally inclusive communities. Provides information, resources, and education on immigration, settlement, health, inclusion, and diversity. Also produces 'Cultures West,' a bi-annual publication about immigration, diversity, and settlement.

Site.Name: Diversity Health Fair
Site.SiteDescription: Free annual event held in Vancouver to promote healthy living. Features numerous exhibitors, health screenings, demonstrations, and entertainment. Promotes awareness of health topics and healthy living, and provides access to information and resources for newcomers and the public. Also offers networking opportunities for immigrant-service agencies, community services, health and social services, and the public. Information is provided in multiple languages, and volunteer interpreters are available as needed.

SiteService.Name: Diversity Health Fair
SiteService.Description: Free annual event held in Vancouver to promote healthy living. Features numerous exhibitors, health screenings, demonstrations, and entertainment. Promotes awareness of health topics and healthy living, and provides access to information and resources for newcomers and the public. Also offers networking opportunities for immigrant-service agencies, community services, health and social services, and the public. Information is provided in multiple languages, and volunteer interpreters are available as needed.

Site.Name: Safe Harbour: Respect for All Program
Site.SiteDescription: Helps businesses and organizations across BC take a leadership role in building safe and inclusive communities that celebrate and welcome diversity. After a two-hour diversity training, the agency receives a window decal to display their commitment to promoting diversity in their community. Safe Harbour certified locations commit to treating all their clients and customers with fairness and respect, and to provide assistance to anyone that has experienced discrimination or mistreatment motivated by racism or hate.

SiteService.Name: Safe Harbour: Respect for All Program
SiteService.Description: Helps businesses and organizations across BC take a leadership role in building safe and inclusive communities that celebrate and welcome diversity. After a two-hour diversity training, the agency receives a window decal to display their commitment to promoting diversity in their community. Safe Harbour certified locations commit to treating all their clients and customers with fairness and respect, and to provide assistance to anyone that has experienced discrimination or mistreatment motivated by racism or hate.

Agency.Name: Native Courtworker and Counselling Association of BC (NCCABC)
Agency.AgencyDescription: Provides assistance to Aboriginal people in conflict with the law, ensuring full participation in the justice system through a holistic approach including prevention and intervention. Hours are 9 am to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Chilliwack Office
Site.SiteDescription: Offers courtworker services to Aboriginals who are in conflict with the law including those having difficulty with substance misuse or problem gambling. Services include providing legal information about the court process, charges, and pleas; accompaniment; providing ongoing support from an Aboriginal perspective; explaining the court process and providing translators; and speaking on behalf of clients at time of sentence, bail, or remand, if requested. Serves Abbotsford and Chilliwack.

SiteService.Name: Chilliwack Office
SiteService.Description: Offers courtworker services to Aboriginals who are in conflict with the law including those having difficulty with substance misuse or problem gambling. Services include providing legal information about the court process, charges, and pleas; accompaniment; providing ongoing support from an Aboriginal perspective; explaining the court process and providing translators; and speaking on behalf of clients at time of sentence, bail, or remand, if requested. Serves Abbotsford and Chilliwack.

Site.Name: Surrey Law Courts Office
Site.SiteDescription: <p> Provides assistance to Aboriginal people in conflict with the law through a variety of services, including information and advice concerning people's rights and responsibilities before the law, accompaniment, advocacy, and prevention programs. Also offers counselling and referral services to victims of crime. Criminal court services include providing legal information about the court process, charges, and pleas; providing ongoing support to clients from an Aboriginal perspective; interpreting the court process and providing translators; and speaking on behalf of clients at time of sentence, bail, or remand, if requested. Youth court services assist in developing diversion programs, explaining charges, and court preparation. Office hours are 8:30 am to 12:30 pm and 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.</p>

SiteService.Name: Surrey Law Courts Office
SiteService.Description: <p> Provides assistance to Aboriginal people in conflict with the law through a variety of services, including information and advice concerning people's rights and responsibilities before the law, accompaniment, advocacy, and prevention programs. Also offers counselling and referral services to victims of crime. Criminal court services include providing legal information about the court process, charges, and pleas; providing ongoing support to clients from an Aboriginal perspective; interpreting the court process and providing translators; and speaking on behalf of clients at time of sentence, bail, or remand, if requested. Youth court services assist in developing diversion programs, explaining charges, and court preparation. Office hours are 8:30 am to 12:30 pm and 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.</p>

Site.Name: Robson Law Courts Office
Site.SiteDescription: Offers courtworker services such as information and referral, advocacy, and court accompaniment to Aboriginal youth. Also assists in developing diversion programs, explaining charges, and court preparation. Offers the <b>Native Youth and Family Advocate</b> program, which provides services to youth involved with criminal court and their families such as advocacy, mediation (including with MCFD), and information and referral. Also provides referrals to crisis counselling.

SiteService.Name: Robson Law Courts Office
SiteService.Description: Offers courtworker services such as information and referral, advocacy, and court accompaniment to Aboriginal youth. Also assists in developing diversion programs, explaining charges, and court preparation. Offers the <b>Native Youth and Family Advocate</b> program, which provides services to youth involved with criminal court and their families such as advocacy, mediation (including with MCFD), and information and referral. Also provides referrals to crisis counselling.

Site.Name: Surrey Alcohol and Drug Services
Site.SiteDescription: Alcohol and drug counsellor provides counselling and referral services to Aboriginal people and those of Aboriginal descent who are having difficulties with substance misuse.

SiteService.Name: Surrey Alcohol and Drug Services
SiteService.Description: Alcohol and drug counsellor provides counselling and referral services to Aboriginal people and those of Aboriginal descent who are having difficulties with substance misuse.

Site.Name: Lower Mainland Regional Office
Site.SiteDescription: <b>Native Courtworkers</b> provide information, guidance, referral, and advocacy to Aboriginal people in conflict with the law. The <b>Alcohol and Drug Program</b> offers counselling and referrals as well as follow-up services to referred clients. The <b>Aboriginal Detox Follow-up</b> reviews individual treatment and/or after-care plans, identifies implementation issues and needs, and refers clients to appropriate addiction and community services. The <b>Aboriginal Elders Support Program</b> provides cultural support and advice to Aboriginal clients by teaching how to make cultural and ceremonial regalia; clients participate in drumming, singing, and storytelling. Office hours are 8:30 am to 12:30 pm and 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

SiteService.Name: Lower Mainland Regional Office
SiteService.Description: <b>Native Courtworkers</b> provide information, guidance, referral, and advocacy to Aboriginal people in conflict with the law. The <b>Alcohol and Drug Program</b> offers counselling and referrals as well as follow-up services to referred clients. The <b>Aboriginal Detox Follow-up</b> reviews individual treatment and/or after-care plans, identifies implementation issues and needs, and refers clients to appropriate addiction and community services. The <b>Aboriginal Elders Support Program</b> provides cultural support and advice to Aboriginal clients by teaching how to make cultural and ceremonial regalia; clients participate in drumming, singing, and storytelling. Office hours are 8:30 am to 12:30 pm and 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.

Site.Name: Vancouver Alcohol and Drug Services
Site.SiteDescription: Works with courtworkers to assist people with substance abuse issues. Provides addiction counselling and referrals to treatment centres, follow-up, and after-care. Also refers to educational institutions, employment preparation, and life skills training. For Aboriginal people primarily. Uses the medicine wheel approach to wellness, and provides choices of other forms of recreation.

SiteService.Name: Vancouver Alcohol and Drug Services
SiteService.Description: Works with courtworkers to assist people with substance abuse issues. Provides addiction counselling and referrals to treatment centres, follow-up, and after-care. Also refers to educational institutions, employment preparation, and life skills training. For Aboriginal people primarily. Uses the medicine wheel approach to wellness, and provides choices of other forms of recreation.

Site.Name: North Vancouver Office and Courthouse
Site.SiteDescription: <p> Provides assistance to Aboriginal people in conflict with the law through a variety of services, including information and advice concerning people's rights and responsibilities before the law, accompaniment, advocacy, and prevention programs. Also offers referral services to victims of crime. Criminal court services include providing legal information about the court process, charges, and pleas; providing ongoing support to clients from an Aboriginal perspective; interpreting the court process and providing translators; and speaking on behalf of clients at time of sentence, bail, or remand, if requested. Youth court services assist in developing diversion programs, explaining charges, and court preparation. Office hours are 8:30 am to 12:30 pm and 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm Monday to Friday.</p>

SiteService.Description: <p> Provides assistance to Aboriginal people in conflict with the law through a variety of services, including information and advice concerning people's rights and responsibilities before the law, accompaniment, advocacy, and prevention programs. SiteService.Name: Main Street Courthouse
SiteService.Description: <p> Provides assistance to Aboriginal people in conflict with the law through a variety of services, including information and advice concerning people's rights and responsibilities before the law, court accompaniment, advocacy, and prevention programs. Also offers counselling and referral services to victims of crime. Criminal court services include providing legal information about the court process, charges, and pleas; providing ongoing support to clients from an Aboriginal perspective; interpreting the court process and providing translators; and speaking on behalf of clients at time of sentence, bail, or remand, if requested. Agency.Name: Circle of Eagles Lodge Society (COELS)
Agency.AgencyDescription: A community residential facility providing care and custody to Aboriginal men, 19 years of age and over who have been conditionally released from federal institutions. Accepts those with or without addiction issues, but must abstain during residency. Also accepts men on substitution therapy. Provides room and board, life skills training and job preparation, self-help&nbsp; employment programs, and traditional healing practices. Not wheelchair accessible. Referral and funding is by Corrections Services Canada. Office and intake hours are 8 am to 4 pm Monday to Friday. Nonprofit, charitable organization.

Site.Name: Anderson Lodge
Site.SiteDescription: Provides temporary housing (with seven single rooms and two double rooms) for women age 19 and over for up to six months. Nine out of 11 beds are designated for Aboriginal women. Five beds are for women who are homeless and need somewhere stable to live while they organize their life; they may be dealing with addiction, family violence, or other issues. Five beds are designated for federally sentenced women who have been conditionally released to the community. One bed is designated as an emergency bed. Services include counselling from an elder, sweat lodges, and support in finding resources and getting oriented in life. Rules require that residents be clean and sober, be on time for curfew, phone to check in while out in the community, and not associate with men participating in the Circle of Eagles programs. 24-hour staff are available, with meals provided. Referral is through Ministry of Social Development and Social Innovation, or from addiction services. Applicants must have at least 72 hours clean time to be eligible. Not wheelchair accessible, and no pets are allowed. Office hours are 8 am to 4 pm Monday to Friday. Receives funding from Lu'ma Native Housing Society.

SiteService.Name: Anderson Lodge
SiteService.Description: Provides temporary housing (with seven single rooms and two double rooms) for women age 19 and over for up to six months. Nine out of 11 beds are designated for Aboriginal women. Five beds are for women who are homeless and need somewhere stable to live while they organize their life; they may be dealing with addiction, family violence, or other issues. Five beds are designated for federally sentenced women who have been conditionally released to the community. One bed is designated as an emergency bed. Services include counselling from an elder, sweat lodges, and support in finding resources and getting oriented in life. Rules require that residents be clean and sober, be on time for curfew, phone to check in while out in the community, and not associate with men participating in the Circle of Eagles programs. 24-hour staff are available, with meals provided. Referral is through Ministry of Social Development and Social Innovation, or from addiction services. Applicants must have at least 72 hours clean time to be eligible. Not wheelchair accessible, and no pets are allowed. Office hours are 8 am to 4 pm Monday to Friday. Receives funding from Lu'ma Native Housing Society.

Agency.Name: Airspace Action on Smoking and Health
Agency.AgencyDescription: Lobbies all levels of government and business globally for smoke-free air in all public places and workplaces. Current campaigns include smoke-free multi-unit dwellings, eliminating tobacco sales in pharmacies and duty-free, increasing cigarette taxes, making tobacco possession/use illegal for minors, implementing province-wide ban on smoking in parks and other outdoor gathering areas, and establishing a regulatory body for sale/use of electronic cigarettes. Participates in health advocacy, legal actions, and events. Ultimate goal is the total eradication of the tobacco industry from the face of the planet. Registered nonprofit society.

Site.Name: Airspace Action on Smoking and Health
Site.SiteDescription: Lobbies all levels of government and business globally for smoke-free air in all public places and workplaces. Current campaigns include smoke-free multi-unit dwellings, eliminating tobacco sales in pharmacies and duty-free, increasing cigarette taxes, making tobacco possession/use illegal for minors, implementing province-wide ban on smoking in parks and other outdoor gathering areas, and establishing a regulatory body for sale/use of electronic cigarettes. Participates in health advocacy, legal actions, and events. Ultimate goal is the total eradication of the tobacco industry from the face of the planet. Registered nonprofit society.
